title: Devfix.com Shares the Issues about the “Slide to Upgrade” bug in Apple devices and the Fail-safe Ways to Resolve It
text:
With the world becoming digital, people cannot help but be awed by the massive innovations and technological advancements. With the birth of the internet and the computers, everything has become a lot simpler such as accessing information, doing business transactions as well as communicating with people all over the world. The release of new mobile gadgets has made a great impact on how people live in this modern time.
With the constant innovative tactics of every company to produce mobile devices with unbeaten features over the other brands, Apple, the makers of the iPhone and Ipad has just launched the iOS9. Apple devices have gained massive recognition because of its sophisticated designs and the many interesting features that can only be used in Apple mobile gadgets.
The latest iOs9 focuses on the improvement of the Iphone and the Ipad in terms of its performance and stability. The iOS9 is the upgraded version of the previous OS because there are a lot of issues that a great number of Apple device users have experienced. On the contrary, this latest Apple feature, the “Slide to Upgrade” bug created frustration among iPhone users all over the world and the dilemma of most people who have experienced using the iOS9 is that their devices have become unresponsive or frozen after the “Slide to Upgrade” feature appears on the screen especially during the performance of the upgrade.
Apple has been aware of the massive complaints of their gadget users and they have informed the general public through their posts on how to resolve the performance issues. They have posted some tips and guidelines as to how to perform iPhone repair on unresponsive devices. The procedure is absolutely easy especially for Apple gadget aficionados because they would just have to perform force restart on their iPhone devices. Along with the force restart, restoring the programs is the next step. This procedure can be used on all iPhone devices, says the makers of Apple gadgets.
Apple is looking into developing the improved iOS9 which will be called the iOS9.1 and, in fact, this has already been made available in beta. It is actually very easy to perform the upgrade since the only thing that needs to be done is to connect the Apple devices to a Mac Book or any PC via the USB cable. The Itunes application just needs to be launched and the device needs to be restarted after selecting IPhone or IPad after being detected by iTunes.
The restoration and upgrading procedure is meant to work in any Apple device for whatever is the cause for it to become unresponsive. Since Apple has fixed this alarming issue, and what else could ever go wrong?
